sentence.idiomatic: He hasn't arrived yet, wait a while.
As soon as you arrive in Beijing give me a phone call.
Will you arrive soon?
I couldn't get a return ticket; I can't get back.
I've heard it's really difficult to buy a return ticket.
He was afraid he wouldn't be able to get a ticket for that day, so he returned earlier.
He speaks so quickly, I couldn't hear a thing clearly.
Is especially strong coffee good?
She can drink a lot of red wine.
This train is departing from Hangzhou, non-stop to Beijing.
They can take you directly to your destination, it's very convenient.
Is there an elevator directly to the top floor?
The heavier things should be held by the boys.
Taking a sleeper is a little more comfortable, but a little more expensive.
I have heard some of his songs before.
Today there aren't many people lined up.
If you have to line up to eat--I'm not eating.
How come you don't go line up over there?
I'll finish my assignment, then go have fun.
I don't have money. I should wait until I get my salary and then buy it.
Why did you eat and then come over?
Are there any night trains to Beijing on the third?
There are express trains and non-stop trains. The non-stop train is a little quicker. You sleep for a while and then you're there.
Does the non-stop train have a hard sleeper?
The non-stop train only has soft seats and soft sleepers.
How much is the soft sleeper?
That's expensive! Does the express train have a hard sleeper?
There is only an upper berth.
Then....ahh...
Hurry up. There are a lot of people waiting in line behind you! Next!
Wait, wait. I'll take the non-stop soft sleeper. Can I buy a return ticket for the fifth?
There aren't any. You can buy one when you get to Beijing.
